House Bill/Resolution NO. HB08260
FULL TITLE : AN ACT PROVIDING FOR THE MANDATORY INSTRUCTION OF PHILIPPINE CINEMA APPRECIATION IN SECONDARY EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS IN THE COUNTRY AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES
ABSTRACT : Mandates the Department of Education , in consultation with the National Commission for Culture and Arts, Film Development Council of the Philippines and the University of the Philippines Film Institute, to formulate courses and lectures on Philippine Cinema to be taught in secondary schools across the country as separate subjects or incorporated in existing subjects now being taught to focus on its appreciation as a collective body of artistic creation that enhance and reflect the cultural and societal identity of our nation.
ALIAS NAME : “Philippine Cinema Appreciation Act for High School Students.”
PRINCIPAL AUTHOR/S : ELAGO, SARAH JANE I.
DATE FILED : 2018-09-18
SIGNIFICANCE: NATIONAL
ACTIONS TAKEN BY THE COMMITTEE ON RULES
REFERRAL TO THE COMMITTEE ON BASIC EDUCATION AND CULTURE ON 2018-09-20
